p: During the pre- and post-weaning periods, all blood metabolites were not altered by BEO supplementation ( Table 5). Similar patterns of BHB, glucose [ 35, 47], urea [ 37], total plasma protein, and IGF-1 [ 56] were found in both treatments. Nevertheless, BHB and urea increased with age ( P ≤ 0.05, Table 5), since they are directly correlated with fatty acid metabolism and ruminal ammonia concentration, respectively [ 57]. The IGF-1 concentration increased with age on the preweaning phase ( P ≤ 0.001). Since this hormone is a mitogen and related to cell proliferation and differentiation, it is correlated with BW and animal growth [ 58].
